title: How to turn protest into powerful change - Eric Liu

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary goal of the powerful citizen in the context of protest and civic engagement?

options.label: A
options.text: To challenge the status quo and force out tyrants

options.label: B
options.text: To expand the frame of the possible and push the boundaries of civic imagination

options.label: C
options.text: To choose a defining fight and create a sharp emblematic contrast

options.label: D
options.text: To secure an early win and create momentum

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of asking "what if" in the context of civic engagement and protest?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a way to dismiss policy ideas that are deemed impossible

options.label: B
options.text: It's a way to define the boundaries of civic imagination and push the frame of the possible outward

options.label: C
options.text: It's a way to create a sharp emblematic contrast and set the terms of a debate

options.label: D
options.text: It's a way to secure an early win and create momentum

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of choosing a defining fight in the context of protest and civic engagement?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a way to dismiss policy ideas that are deemed impossible

options.label: B
options.text: It's a way to set the terms of a debate and create a sharp emblematic contrast

options.label: C
options.text: It's a way to secure an early win and create momentum

options.label: D
options.text: It's a way to challenge the status quo and force out tyrants

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of securing an early win in the context of protest and civic engagement?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a way to dismiss policy ideas that are deemed impossible

options.label: B
options.text: It's a way to set the terms of a debate and create a sharp emblematic contrast

options.label: C
options.text: It's a way to create momentum and change what people think is possible

options.label: D
options.text: It's a way to challenge the status quo and force out tyrants

multiple-choice.question: What is the key to successfully expanding the frame of the possible, choosing a defining fight, and securing an early win?

options.label: A
options.text: Being anyone special

options.label: B
options.text: Being a participant and living like a citizen

options.label: C
options.text: Having a lot of money and power

options.label: D
options.text: Having a lot of power

title: Self-assembly: The power of organizing the unorganized - Skylar Tibbits

multiple-choice.question: What is the key concept that allows our bodies to regrow and repair themselves, and why can't man-made objects exhibit this trait?

options.label: A
options.text: Genetics

options.label: B
options.text: Self assembly

options.label: C
options.text: Artificial intelligence

options.label: D
options.text: Robotics

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is a key benefit of using self assembly in construction compared to traditional methods?

options.label: A
options.text: Self assembly is slower and more expensive

options.label: B
options.text: Self assembly is faster and more precise

options.label: C
options.text: Self assembly requires human intervention

options.label: D
options.text: Self assembly is only used in biology and chemistry

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following examples illustrates how self assembly can be used to create a precise sphere?

options.label: A
options.text: Building a sphere using traditional construction methods

options.label: B
options.text: Creating a sphere using self assembly by inflating it like a bubble or a balloon

options.label: C
options.text: Designing a connection between the components like magnets and dumping them into a container

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one potential application of self assembly in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: Building self-driving cars

options.label: B
options.text: Creating artificial intelligence

options.label: C
options.text: Making materials that can repair themselves

options.label: D
options.text: Developing a new form of energy

multiple-choice.question: What is an analogy used in the transcript to describe how self assembly works?

options.label: A
options.text: A factory and copy machines

options.label: B
options.text: A bicycle chain with sequences of amino acid links

options.label: C
options.text: A soccer ball made up of sub-units with specific shapes

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what are some factors that contribute to the self-assembly of proteins into 3-D structures?

options.label: A
options.text: The interaction between amino acids along the chain

options.label: B
options.text: The relationship between the chain and the environment

options.label: C
options.text: The interaction between the chain and other proteins

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of how self assembly can be used to create a 3-D structure with DNA?

options.label: A
options.text: By designing a connection between the components like magnets and dumping them into a container

options.label: B
options.text: By creating many identical pieces that would come together to make a 3-D structure

options.label: C
options.text: By giving the right conditions to form themselves into organized pathways

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one potential benefit of using self assembly in design and engineering?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for faster and more precise construction

options.label: B
options.text: It reduces the need for human intervention

options.label: C
options.text: It makes materials less reliant on fossil fuels

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

options.label: A
options.text: By building a sphere using traditional construction methods

options.label: B
options.text: By creating a sphere using self assembly by inflating it like a bubble or a balloon

options.label: C
options.text: By designing a connection between the components like magnets and dumping them into a container

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above
